title-group.article-title: Development of High Performance Valve Seat Insert Materials for Heavy-duty Engines

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2007 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Sintered materials have been applied widely for Valve Seat Inserts (VSI) due to their high flexibility of material design. Hard particle dispersion type materials, which have specific microstructures in sintered material, are popular for VSIs. The load - temperature, combustion pressure, etc. - on the VSI has become severer along with increasing demands for better engine performance. (1) Especially, there is increasing tendency of the amount of wear on VSIs when used in heavy-duty engines such as diesel/gas (LPG, CNG) engines because of their dry environments.(2) In this paper, two new developed high performance VSI materials for heavy-duty engines are introduced. These materials adopt new hard particles and a new method of distribution of the solid lubricant to increase wear resistance. ➀Hard Particles : The new developed hard particle has superior wear resistance due to increasing the amount of intermetallic compounds. ➁Lubrication : A new method has been developed that has superior lubrication by distributing the lubricant in the matrix using precipitation during sintering.

ref.mixed-citation: S. Limino, A. Hamada and T. Kenmoku : "New Fe- Base Exhaust Valve Material for Higher Heat Resistance", SAE Technical Paper 980704

H. Yamamoto "Tribology of Valve Trains for Environmentally friendly Engine", Journal of Japanese Society of Tribologists, Vol.49 (2004) 769-774
Y.Aoyagi "Diesel Combustion in High-Boosted harging and High-Pressure Fuel Injection", Jidousha- Gijutsu, Vol.58 No.4(2004) 13-18
